name: Age Calculator Vanilla JS
desc: This project offers an intuitive Age Calculator developed for the Frontend Mentor challenge. Users input their date of birth, and the calculator swiftly computes their age, presenting the result seamlessly. Crafted with a blend of vanilla JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, the interface ensures a smooth user experience. To enhance functionality, a date picker from the jQuery library is seamlessly integrated. Moreover, it's hosted on Netlify, ensuring accessibility to users across the web.

name: To Do List Vanilla JS
desc: This project introduces a To-Do List App designed for the Frontend Mentor challenge. Users can seamlessly add their to-do list items, streamlining their task management process. Crafted with a combination of vanilla JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, the interface ensures simplicity and efficiency.

name: To Do List React
desc: This project marks my first venture into ReactJS, where I recreated my To-Do List app from its original Vanilla JS version. It serves as a milestone in my journey of learning and exploring React. Hosted on Netlify, it's readily accessible, while its open-source nature invites collaboration and improvement. You can find the project repository on GitHub for further exploration.

name: Advice Generator
desc: This project is an Advice Generator, a pivotal step in my React journey where I delved into utilizing APIs. Through this endeavor, I gained hands-on experience integrating APIs seamlessly into React applications. As I embarked on this learning journey, I discovered the power and versatility APIs offer in enhancing user experiences. This project marks a significant milestone in my React development journey, showcasing my newfound skills in API integration and React application development.

name: Tic Tac Toe Vanilla JS
desc: This project is a Tic Tac Toe game developed entirely in Vanilla JavaScript, serving as a playground for mastering dynamic function creation. Through this endeavor, I honed my skills in crafting interactive and dynamic functionalities within web applications. Building this game provided invaluable hands-on experience in implementing logic and interactivity using JavaScript. It stands as a testament to my journey of learning and mastering dynamic function creation in web development.

name: myFriends App
desc: The myFriends app represents a significant milestone in my journey of backend development, constructed with Laravel, Tailwind CSS, and MySQL. Through this project, I delved deep into Laravel's capabilities, mastering essential functionalities like user authentication with login, register, and logout features. Beyond authentication, the app allows users to maintain a logbook of friends, enabling them to add and store friend details seamlessly. This project served as a comprehensive learning experience in backend development, providing hands-on practice in leveraging Laravel's powerful features to create functional and user-friendly web applications.
